newsitem.title: FRANCE: French jobs conference start seen in Sept -Blondel.
newsitem.headline: French jobs conference start seen in Sept -Blondel.

text.p: French Force Ouvriere trade union boss Marc Blondel said on Wednesday after meeting Prime Minister Lionel Jospin that he expected a planned national conference on wages and jobs to start in September.
The conference, grouping unions and employers, was proposed by Jospin before his left-wing government won a recent French parliamentary election but an official start date has yet to be set.

"We're being told it will take time to prepare, that we will have to hold consultations. I believe, but this is me, Blondel speaking, that things points to September, given that there will be certain elements to come in advance, including the SMIC (national minimum wage)," Blondel told reporters after meeting Jospin.
Blondel was one of several trade union bosses and employers' represenatives meeting Jospin on Wednesday and Thursday.
The conference is expected to gather employers and unions to discuss linked issues of wages, the possibility of reorganising and reducing work time and creating employment.
